TopicTitle: Scaling planets for difficulty - proper KSP version

Articles.Content:
Hello,

After a hiatus I wanted to try reverting back from kerbalism and all the good mods for a scaled-up system with vanilla parts for a simple career but with added difficulty.

 

I have played scaled-up with RSS-RP in the past but this time I was unable to scale up the system successfully. With Rescale I either crashed on loading KSC or the planets were not scaled.

 

I own both DLCs. I tried multiple versions (1.08, 1.09, 1.10, 1.11) with Rescale 2.5x installed through ckan (and all dependancies) without success, and I also tried a bunch of combinations by manually installing the mods (kopernicus, module manager, rescale). Now I might be doing something wrong, so if someone could confirm that x mod(s) on x version is sure to work I'll know to focus my efforts on this combination until it works.

 

TLDR questions: as of today what is a mod(s) + KSP version combination that is known to work for scaling up planets without changing parts? Is there an alternative to Rescale mods?

 

Hope this reaches someone, and thanks.

Alex

A really off-the-rails solution would be to reimplement the whole KSP system.

-Get Kopernicus

-Export all the stock bodies as cfg files using KittopiaTech

-Adjust the radius of each celestial body

-Write some RemoveStockBodies code

-Run the RemoveStockBodies cfg and celestial body cfgs as a "planet pack". If all goes well, the stock system should be scaled up.

I've never tried this, but hey, it's an interesting experiment.

Hey wpetula,

 

Thanks for this. I was hoping I could use someone else's hard work but what you suggested may be better than installing an old version in the end, and it would be nice not to depend on others after every patch. I will dig into KittopiaTech and see if I can triumph over my incompetence.

 

Picking your brain a little further, could you confirm that atmosphere altitude and g would remain constant when increasing radii this way?

 

Cheers!

On 3/29/2021 at 11:46 AM, ObesosDen said:

Picking your brain a little further, could you confirm that atmosphere altitude and g would remain constant when increasing radii this way?

Atmosphere altitude and gravity can be adjusted as you please in a custom config file.  If you export a stock body's config file using KittopiaTech, change only its radii, and reimplement it back into the game, its atmosphere height and gravity should be unchanged.
